intro: Hieracium lippmaa, commonly known as the Lippmaa hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium lippmaa is often found in open habitats and can spread through its rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
